                       It is intentionally scoped to the PATH environment
                       variable and nothing else for security reasons.

     _r_e_b_o_o_t _[_s_y_s_t_e_m_|_u_s_e_r_s_p_a_c_e_|_h_a_l_t_|_l_o_g_o_u_t_|_a_p_p_s_]
              Instructs llaauunncchhdd to begin tearing down userspace. With no argu-
              ment given or with the _s_y_s_t_e_m argument given, llaauunncchhdd will make
              the reboot(2) system call when userspace has been completely
              torn down. With the _h_a_l_t argument given, llaauunncchhdd will make the
              reboot(2) system call when userspace has been completely torn
              down and pass the _R_B___H_A_L_T flag, halting the system and not ini-
              tiating a reboot.

              With the _u_s_e_r_s_p_a_c_e argument given, llaauunncchhdd will re-exec itself
              when userspace has been torn down and bring userspace back up.
              This is useful for rebooting the system quickly under conditions
              where kernel data structures or hardware do not need to be re-
              initialized.

              With the _l_o_g_o_u_t argument given, launchd will tear down the
              caller's GUI login session in a manner similar to a logout ini-
              tiated from the Apple menu. The key difference is that a logout
              initiated through this subcommand will be much faster since it
              will not give apps a chance to display modal dialogs to block
              logout indefinitely; therefore there is data corruption risk to
              using this option. Only use it when you know you have no unsaved
              data in your running apps.

              With the _a_p_p_s argument given, launchd will terminate all apps
              running in the caller's GUI login session that did not come from
              a launchd.plist(5) on-disk. Apps like Finder, Dock and Syste-
              mUIServer will be unaffected. Apps are terminated in the same
              manner as the _l_o_g_o_u_t argument, and all the same caveats apply.

              --ss       When rebooting the machine (either a full reboot or
                       userspace reboot), brings the subsequent boot session
                       up in single-user mode.

     _e_r_r_o_r _[_p_o_s_i_x_|_m_a_c_h_|_b_o_o_t_s_t_r_a_p_] _c_o_d_e
              Prints a human-readable string of the given error _c_o_d_e.  By
              default, llaauunncchhccttll will attempt to guess which error domain the
              code given belongs to. The caller may optionally specify which
              domain (either _p_o_s_i_x, _m_a_c_h, or _b_o_o_t_s_t_r_a_p) to interpret the given
              code as an error from that subsystem.

     _v_a_r_i_a_n_t  Prints the llaauunncchhdd variant currently active on the system. Pos-
              sible variants include RELEASE, DEVELOPMENT and DEBUG.

     _v_e_r_s_i_o_n  Prints the llaauunncchhdd version string.

LLEEGGAACCYY SSUUBBCCOOMMMMAANNDDSS
     Subcommands from the previous implementation of llaauunncchhdd are generally
     available, though some may be unimplemented. Unimplemented subcommands
     are documented as such.

     _l_o_a_d | _u_n_l_o_a_d [--wwFF] [--SS _s_e_s_s_i_o_n_t_y_p_e] [--DD _s_e_a_r_c_h_p_a_t_h] _p_a_t_h_s _._._.
              Load the specified configuration files or directories of config-
              uration files.  Jobs that are not on-demand will be started as
              soon as possible. All specified jobs will be loaded before any
              of them are allowed to start. Note that per-user configuration
              files (LaunchAgents) must be owned by root (if they are located
              in //LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhAAggeennttss) or the user loading them (if they are
              located in $$HHOOMMEE//LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhAAggeennttss).  All system-wide daemons
              (LaunchDaemons) must be owned by root. Configuration files must
              disallow group and world writes. These restrictions are in place
              for security reasons, as allowing writability to a launchd con-
              figuration file allows one to specify which executable will be
              launched.

              Note that allowing non-root write access to the
              //SSyysstteemm//LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhDDaaeemmoonnss directory WILL render your system
              unbootable.

              --ww       Overrides the Disabled key and sets it to false or true
                       for the load and unload subcommands respectively. In
                       previous versions, this option would modify the config-
                       uration file. Now the state of the Disabled key is
                       stored elsewhere on- disk in a location that may not be
                       directly manipulated by any process other than llaauunncchhdd.

              --FF       Force the loading or unloading of the plist. Ignore the
                       Disabled key.

              --SS _s_e_s_s_i_o_n_t_y_p_e
                       Some jobs only make sense in certain contexts. This
                       flag instructs llaauunncchhccttll to look for jobs in a differ-
                       ent location when using the -D flag, and allows
                       llaauunncchhccttll to restrict which jobs are loaded into which
                       session types. Sessions are only relevant for per-user
                       llaauunncchhdd contexts. Relevant sessions are Aqua (the
                       default), Background and LoginWindow.  Background
                       agents may be loaded independently of a GUI login. Aqua
                       agents are loaded only when a user has logged in at the
                       GUI. LoginWindow agents are loaded when the LoginWindow
                       UI is displaying and currently run as root.

              --DD _s_e_a_r_c_h_p_a_t_h
                       Load or unload all plist(5) files in the search path
                       given. This option may be thought of as expanding into
                       many individual paths depending on the search path
                       given. Valid search paths include "system," "local,"
                       and "all." When providing a session type, an additional
                       search path is available for use called "user." For
                       example, without a session type given, "-D system"
                       would load from or unload all property list files from
                       //SSyysstteemm//LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhDDaaeemmoonnss.  With a session type
                       passed, it would load from
                       //SSyysstteemm//LLiibbrraarryy//LLaauunncchhAAggeennttss.  Note that llaauunncchhccttll no
                       longer respects the network search path.

                       In a previous version of launchd, these search paths
                       were called "domains", hence -D. The word "domain" is
                       now used for a totally different concept.

              _N_O_T_E: Due to bugs in the previous implementation and long-stand-
              ing client expectations around those bugs, the _l_o_a_d and _u_n_l_o_a_d
              subcommands will only return a non-zero exit code due to
              improper usage.  Otherwise, zero is always returned.

     _s_u_b_m_i_t --ll _l_a_b_e_l [--pp _e_x_e_c_u_t_a_b_l_e] [--oo _s_t_d_o_u_t_-_p_a_t_h] [--ee _s_t_d_e_r_r_-_p_a_t_h] _-_-
              _c_o_m_m_a_n_d [_a_r_g_0] [_a_r_g_1] [_._._.]
              A simple way of submitting a program to run without a configura-
              tion file. This mechanism also tells launchd to keep the program
              alive in the event of failure.

              --ll _l_a_b_e_l
                       What unique label to assign this job to launchd.

              --pp _p_r_o_g_r_a_m
                       What program to really execute, regardless of what fol-
                       lows the -- in the submit sub-command.

              --oo _s_t_d_o_u_t_-_p_a_t_h
                       Where to send the stdout of the program.

              --ee _s_t_d_e_r_r_-_p_a_t_h
                       Where to send the stderr of the program.

     _r_e_m_o_v_e _l_a_b_e_l
              Remove the job from launchd by label. This subcommand will
              return immediately and not block until the job has been stopped.

     _s_t_a_r_t _l_a_b_e_l
              Start the specified job by label. The expected use of this sub-
              command is for debugging and testing so that one can manually
              kick-start an on-demand server.

     _s_t_o_p _l_a_b_e_l
              Stop the specified job by label. If a job is on-demand, launchd
              may immediately restart the job if launchd finds any criteria
              that is satisfied.

     _l_i_s_t [_-_x] [_l_a_b_e_l]
              With no arguments, list all of the jobs loaded into llaauunncchhdd in
              three columns. The first column displays the PID of the job if
              it is running.  The second column displays the last exit status
              of the job. If the number in this column is negative, it repre-
              sents the negative of the signal which stopped the job. Thus,
              "-15" would indicate that the job was terminated with SIGTERM.
              The third column is the job's label. If [_l_a_b_e_l] is specified,
              prints information about the requested job.

              --xx       This flag is no longer supported.

     _s_e_t_e_n_v _k_e_y _v_a_l_u_e
              Specify an environment variable to be set on all future pro-
              cesses launched by llaauunncchhdd in the caller's context.

     _u_n_s_e_t_e_n_v _k_e_y
              Specify that an environment variable no longer be set on any
              future processes launched by llaauunncchhdd in the caller's context.

     _g_e_t_e_n_v _k_e_y
              Print the value of an environment variable that llaauunncchhdd would
              set for all processes launched into the caller's context.

     _e_x_p_o_r_t   Export all of the environment variables of llaauunncchhdd for use in a
              shell eval statement.

     _g_e_t_r_u_s_a_g_e _s_e_l_f | _c_h_i_l_d_r_e_n
              Get the resource utilization statistics for llaauunncchhdd or the chil-
              dren of llaauunncchhdd.  This subcommand is not implemented.

     _l_o_g [_l_e_v_e_l _l_o_g_l_e_v_e_l] [_o_n_l_y | _m_a_s_k _l_o_g_l_e_v_e_l_s_._._.]
              Get and set the syslog(3) log level mask. The available log lev-
              els are: debug, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert
              and emergency. This subcommand is not implemented.

     _l_i_m_i_t [_c_p_u | _f_i_l_e_s_i_z_e | _d_a_t_a | _s_t_a_c_k | _c_o_r_e | _r_s_s | _m_e_m_l_o_c_k | _m_a_x_p_r_o_c |
              _m_a_x_f_i_l_e_s] [_b_o_t_h [_s_o_f_t | _h_a_r_d]]
              With no arguments, this command prints all the resource limits
              of llaauunncchhdd as found via getrlimit(2).  When a given resource is
              specified, it prints the limits for that resource. With a third
              argument, it sets both the hard and soft limits to that value.
              With four arguments, the third and forth argument represent the
              soft and hard limits respectively.  See setrlimit(2).

     _s_h_u_t_d_o_w_n
              Tell llaauunncchhdd to prepare for shutdown by removing all jobs. This
              subcommand is not implemented.

     _u_m_a_s_k [_n_e_w_m_a_s_k]
              Get or optionally set the umask(2) of llaauunncchhdd.  This subcommand
              is not implemented.

     _b_s_l_i_s_t [_P_I_D | _._.] [_-_j]
              This subcommand is not implemented and has been superseded by
              the _p_r_i_n_t subcommand, which provides much richer information.

     _b_s_e_x_e_c _P_I_D _c_o_m_m_a_n_d [_a_r_g_s]
              This executes the given command in as similar an execution con-
              text as possible to the target PID. Adopted attributes include
              the Mach bootstrap namespace, exception server and security
              audit session. It does not modify the process' credentials (UID,
              GID, etc.) or adopt any environment variables from the target
              process. It affects only the Mach bootstrap context and
              directly-related attributes.

     _a_s_u_s_e_r _U_I_D _c_o_m_m_a_n_d [_a_r_g_s]
              This executes the given command in as similar an execution con-
              text as possible to that of the target user's bootstrap. Adopted
              attributes include the Mach bootstrap namespace, exception
              server and security audit session. It does not modify the
              process' credentials (UID, GID, etc.) or adopt any user-specific
              environment variables. It affects only the Mach bootstrap con-
              text and directly- related attributes.

     _b_s_t_r_e_e   This subcommand is not implemented and has been superseded by
              the _p_r_i_n_t subcommand, which provides much richer information.

     _m_a_n_a_g_e_r_p_i_d
              This prints the PID of the launchd which manages the current
              bootstrap. In prior implementations, there could be multiple
              llaauunncchhdd processes each managing their own Mach bootstrap sub-
              sets. In the current implementation, all bootstraps are managed
              by one process, so this subcommand will always print "1".

     _m_a_n_a_g_e_r_u_i_d
              This prints the UID associated with the caller's launchd con-
              text.

     _m_a_n_a_g_e_r_n_a_m_e
              This prints the name of the launchd job manager which manages
              the current launchd context. See LimitLoadToSessionType in
              launchd.plist(5) for more details.

     _h_e_l_p     Print out a quick usage statement.

CCAAVVEEAATTSS
     The output produced by the "legacy" subcommands (chiefly _l_i_s_t) should
     match their output on previous OS X releases. However, the output of
     newer subcommands does not conform to any particular format and is not
     guaranteed to remain stable across releases. These commands are intended
     for use by human developers and system administrators, not for automation
     by programs or scripts. Their output does not constitute an API and no
     promises of forward compatibility are offered to programs that attempt to
     parse it.

DDEEPPRREECCAATTEEDD AANNDD RREEMMOOVVEEDD FFUUNNCCTTIIOONNAALLIITTYY
     llaauunncchhccttll no longer has an interactive mode, nor does it accept commands
     from stdin. The //eettcc//llaauunncchhdd..ccoonnff file is no longer consulted for subcom-
     mands to run during early boot time; this functionality was removed for
     security considerations. While it was documented that $$HHOOMMEE//..llaauunncchhdd..ccoonnff
     would be consulted prior to setting up a user's session, this functional-
     ity was never implemented.

     launchd no longer uses Unix domain sockets for communication, so the
     LLAAUUNNCCHHDD__SSOOCCKKEETT environment variable is no longer relevant and is not set.

     llaauunncchhdd no longer loads configuration files from the network

FFIILLEESS
     ~/Library/LaunchAgents         Per-user agents provided by the user.
     /Library/LaunchAgents          Per-user agents provided by the adminis-
                                    trator.
     /Library/LaunchDaemons         System wide daemons provided by the admin-
                                    istrator.
     /System/Library/LaunchAgents   OS X Per-user agents.
     /System/Library/LaunchDaemons  OS X System wide daemons.

EEXXIITT SSTTAATTUUSS
     llaauunncchhccttll will exit with status 0 if the subcommand succeeded. Otherwise,
     it will exit with an error code that can be given to the _e_r_r_o_r subcommand
     to be decoded into human-readable form.

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
     launchd.plist(5), launchd(8), audit(8), setaudit_addr(2)

summary:
# sips

> Apple Scriptable Image Processing System.
> Raster/Query images and ColorSync ICC Profiles.

- Specify an output directory so that originals do not get modified:

`sips --out {{path/to/out_dir}}`

- Resample image at specified size, Image aspect ratio may be altered:

`sips -z {{1920}} {{300}} {{image.ext}}`

- Resample image so height and width aren't greater than specified size (notice the capital Z):

`sips -Z {{1920}} {{300}} {{image.ext}}`

- Resample all images in a directory to fit a width of 960px (honoring aspect ratio):

`sips --resampleWidth {{960}} {{path/to/images}}`

- Convert an image from CMYK to RGB:

`sips --matchTo '/System/Library/ColorSync/Profiles/Generic RGB Profile.icc' {{path/to/image.ext}} {{path/to/out_dir}}`

- Remove ColorSync ICC profile from an image:

`sips -d profile --deleteColorManagementProperties {{path/to/image.ext}}`

NNAAMMEE
     ssiippss -- scriptable image processing system.

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     ssiippss [_i_m_a_g_e_-_q_u_e_r_y_-_f_u_n_c_t_i_o_n_s] _i_m_a_g_e_f_i_l_e _._._.

     ssiippss [_i_m_a_g_e_-_m_o_d_i_f_i_c_a_t_i_o_n_-_f_u_n_c_t_i_o_n_s] _i_m_a_g_e_f_i_l_e _._._.
          [----oouutt _r_e_s_u_l_t_-_f_i_l_e_-_o_r_-_d_i_r]
     ssiippss [_p_r_o_f_i_l_e_-_m_o_d_i_f_i_c_a_t_i_o_n_-_f_u_n_c_t_i_o_n_s] _p_r_o_f_i_l_e _._._.
          [----oouutt _r_e_s_u_l_t_-_f_i_l_e_-_o_r_-_d_i_r]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     This tool is used to query or modify raster image files and ColorSync ICC
     profiles.  Its functionality can also be used through the "Image Events"
     AppleScript suite.

FFUUNNCCTTIIOONNSS
     Profile query functions:

     --gg _k_e_y
     ----ggeettPPrrooppeerrttyy _k_e_y
           Output the property value for key to stdout.

summary:
# md5

> Calculate MD5 cryptographic checksums.

- Calculate the MD5 checksum for a file:

`md5 {{filename}}`

- Calculate MD5 checksums for multiple files:

`md5 {{filename1}} {{filename2}}`

- Output only the md5 checksum (no filename):

`md5 -q {{filename}}`

- Print a checksum of the given string:

`md5 -s {{string}}`
man_entry:
MD5(1)                    BSD General Commands Manual                   MD5(1)

NNAAMMEE
     mmdd55 -- calculate a message-digest fingerprint (checksum) for a file

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     mmdd55 [--ppqqrrttxx] [--ss _s_t_r_i_n_g] [_f_i_l_e _._._.]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     The mmdd55 utility takes as input a message of arbitrary length and produces
     as output a ``fingerprint'' or ``message digest'' of the input.  It is
     conjectured that it is computationally infeasible to produce two messages
     having the same message digest, or to produce any message having a given
     prespecified target message digest.  The MD5 algorithm is intended for
     digital signature applications, where a large file must be ``compressed''
     in a secure manner before being encrypted with a private (secret) key
     under a public-key cryptosystem such as RSA.

     MD5's designer Ron Rivest has stated "md5 and sha1 are both clearly bro-
     ken (in terms of collision-resistance)".  So MD5 should be avoided when
     creating new protocols, or implementing protocols with better options.
     SHA256 and SHA512 are better options as they have been more resilient to
     attacks (as of 2009).

     The following options may be used in any combination and must precede any
     files named on the command line.  The hexadecimal checksum of each file
     listed on the command line is printed after the options are processed.

     --ss _s_t_r_i_n_g
             Print a checksum of the given _s_t_r_i_n_g.

     --pp      Echo stdin to stdout and append the checksum to stdout.

     --qq      Quiet mode - only the checksum is printed out.  Overrides the --rr
             option.

     --rr      Reverses the format of the output.  This helps with visual diffs.
             Does nothing when combined with the --ppttxx options.

     --tt      Run a built-in time trial.

     --xx      Run a built-in test script.

EEXXIITT SSTTAATTUUSS
     The mmdd55 utility exits 0 on success, and 1 if at least one of the input
     files could not be read.

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
     cksum(1), md5(3), ripemd(3), sha(3), CC_SHA256_Init(3)

     Vlastimil Klima, _F_i_n_d_i_n_g _M_D_5 _C_o_l_l_i_s_i_o_n_s _- _a _T_o_y _F_o_r _a _N_o_t_e_b_o_o_k,
     Cryptology ePrint Archive: Report 2005/075.

AACCKKNNOOWWLLEEDDGGMMEENNTTSS
     This program is placed in the public domain for free general use by RSA
     Data Security.

BSD                              June 6, 2004                              BSD

summary:
# hostname

> Show or set the system's host name.

- Show current host name:

`hostname`

- Set current host name:

`hostname {{new_hostname}}`
man_entry:
HOSTNAME(1)               BSD General Commands Manual              HOSTNAME(1)

NNAAMMEE
     hhoossttnnaammee -- set or print name of current host system

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
     hhoossttnnaammee [--ffss] [_n_a_m_e_-_o_f_-_h_o_s_t]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
     The hhoossttnnaammee utility prints the name of the current host.  The super-user
     can set the hostname by supplying an argument.  To keep the hostname
     between reboots, run `scutil --set HostName _n_a_m_e_-_o_f_-_h_o_s_t'.

     Options:

     --ff    Include domain information in the printed name.  This is the
           default behavior.

     --ss    Trim off any domain information from the printed name.

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
     gethostname(3), scutil(8)

HHIISSTTOORRYY
     The hhoossttnnaammee command appeared in 4.2BSD.

BSD                            December 7, 2006                            BSD

summary:
# opensnoop

> Tool that tracks file opens on your system.

- Print all file opens as they occur:

`sudo opensnoop`

- Track all file opens by a process by name:

`sudo opensnoop -n {{process_name}}`

- Track all file opens by a process by PID:

`sudo opensnoop -p {{PID}}`

- Track which processes open a specified file:

`sudo opensnoop -f {{path/to/file}}`
man_entry:
opensnoop(1m)                    USER COMMANDS                   opensnoop(1m)



NNAAMMEE
       opensnoop - snoop file opens as they occur. Uses DTrace.

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
       ooppeennssnnoooopp [-a|-A|-ceFghstvxZ] [-f pathname] [-n name] [-p PID]

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
       opensnoop  tracks  file opens. As a process issues a file open, details
       such as UID, PID and pathname are printed out.

       The returned file descriptor is printed, a value  of  -1  indicates  an
       error.  This  can be useful for troubleshooting to determine if applia-
       cions are attempting to open files that do not exist.

       Since this uses DTrace, only users with root privileges  can  run  this
       command.

OOPPTTIIOONNSS
       -a     print all data

       -A     dump all data, space delimited

       -c     print current working directory of process

       -e     print errno value

       -F     print the flags passed to open

       -g     print full command arguments

       -s     print start time, us

       -t     print user stack trace

       -v     print start time, string

       -x     only print failed opens

       -Z     print zonename

       -f pathname
              file pathname to snoop

       -n name
              process name to snoop

       -p PID process ID to snoop


EEXXAAMMPPLLEESS
       Default output, print file opens by process as they occur,
              # ooppeennssnnoooopp


       Print human readable timestamps,
              # ooppeennssnnoooopp -v


       See error codes,
              # ooppeennssnnoooopp -e


       Snoop this file only,
              # ooppeennssnnoooopp -f /etc/passwd


FFIIEELLDDSS
       ZONE   Zone name

       UID    User ID

       PID    Process ID

       PPID   Parent Process ID

       FD     File Descriptor (-1 is error)

       FLAGS  Flags passed to open

       ERR    errno value (see /usr/include/sys/errno.h)

       CWD    current working directory of process

       PATH   pathname for file open

       COMM   command name for the process

       ARGS   argument listing for the process

       TIME   timestamp for the open event, us

       STRTIME
              timestamp for the open event, string

DDOOCCUUMMEENNTTAATTIIOONN
       See  the  DTraceToolkit for further documentation under the Docs direc-
       tory. The DTraceToolkit docs may include full worked examples with ver-
       bose descriptions explaining the output.

EEXXIITT
       opensnoop will run forever until Ctrl-C is hit.

BBUUGGSS
       occasionally the pathname for the file open cannot be read and the fol-
       lowing error will be seen,

       dtrace: error on enabled probe ID 6 (...): invalid address

       this is normal behaviour.

AAUUTTHHOORR
       Brendan Gregg [Sydney, Australia]

SSEEEE AALLSSOO
       dtrace(1M), truss(1)




version 1.60                     Jan 12, 2006                    opensnoop(1m)

summary:
# brew

> Package manager for macOS.
> More information: <https://brew.sh>.

- Search for available formulas and casks:

`brew search {{text}}`

- Install the latest stable version of a formula (use `--devel` for development versions):

`brew install {{formula}}`

- List all installed formulae:

`brew list`

- List installed formulae that are not dependencies of another installed formula:

`brew leaves`

- Upgrade an installed formula (if no formula name is given, all installed formulae are upgraded):

`brew upgrade {{formula}}`

- Fetch the newest version of Homebrew and of all formulae from GitHub:

`brew update`

- Remove old versions of installed formulae (if no formula name is given, all installed formulae are processed):

`brew cleanup {{formula}}`

- Display information about a formula (version, installation path, dependencies, etc.):

`brew info {{formula}}`

- Check the local Homebrew installation for potential problems:

`brew doctor`
man_entry:
BREW(1)                              brew                              BREW(1)



NNAAMMEE
       bbrreeww - The Missing Package Manager for macOS

SSYYNNOOPPSSIISS
       bbrreeww ----vveerrssiioonn
       bbrreeww _c_o_m_m_a_n_d [----vveerrbboossee|--vv] [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a] ...

DDEESSCCRRIIPPTTIIOONN
       Homebrew is the easiest and most flexible way to install the UNIX tools
       Apple didn't include with macOS.

EESSSSEENNTTIIAALL CCOOMMMMAANNDDSS
       For the full command list, see the _C_O_M_M_A_N_D_S section.

       With ----vveerrbboossee or ----ddeebbuugg, many commands print extra debugging informa-
       tion. Note that these options should only appear after a command.

   iinnssttaallll _f_o_r_m_u_l_a:
       Install _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is usually the name of the formula to install, but it has other
       syntaxes which are listed in the _S_P_E_C_I_F_Y_I_N_G _F_O_R_M_U_L_A_E section.

   uunniinnssttaallll _f_o_r_m_u_l_a:
       Uninstall _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

   lliisstt:
       List all installed formulae.

   sseeaarrcchh (_t_e_x_t|//_t_e_x_t//):
       Perform a substring search of cask tokens and formula names  for  _t_e_x_t.
       If  _t_e_x_t  is flanked by slashes, it is interpreted as a regular expres-
       sion. The search for _t_e_x_t is extended online to hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree and hhoommee--
       bbrreeww//ccaasskk.  If no search term is provided, all locally available formu-
       lae are listed.

CCOOMMMMAANNDDSS
   aannaallyyttiiccss [_s_u_b_c_o_m_m_a_n_d]
       Control Homebrew's anonymous aggregate user behaviour  analytics.  Read
       more at _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_d_o_c_s_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_A_n_a_l_y_t_i_c_s.

       bbrreeww aannaallyyttiiccss [ssttaattee]
           Display the current state of Homebrew's analytics.

       bbrreeww aannaallyyttiiccss [oonn|ooffff]
           Turn Homebrew's analytics on or off respectively.

       bbrreeww aannaallyyttiiccss rreeggeenneerraattee--uuuuiidd
           Regenerate the UUID used for Homebrew's analytics.

   ccaasskk _c_o_m_m_a_n_d [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_c_a_s_k]
       Homebrew  Cask  provides a friendly CLI workflow for the administration
       of macOS applications distributed as binaries.

       Commands:

       +o   ----ccaacchhee
           Display the file used to cache a _c_a_s_k

       +o   aauuddiitt
           Check _c_a_s_k for Homebrew coding style violations

       +o   ccaatt
           Dump raw source of a _c_a_s_k to the standard output

       +o   ccrreeaattee
           Creates the given _c_a_s_k and opens it in an editor

       +o   ddooccttoorr
           Checks for configuration issues

       +o   eeddiitt
           Open the given _c_a_s_k for editing

       +o   ffeettcchh
           Downloads remote application files to local cache

       +o   hheellpp
           Print help for ccaasskk commands

       +o   hhoommee
           Opens the homepage of the given _c_a_s_k

       +o   iinnffoo
           Displays information about the given _c_a_s_k

       +o   iinnssttaallll
           Installs the given _c_a_s_k

       +o   lliisstt
           Lists installed casks or the casks provided in the arguments

       +o   oouuttddaatteedd
           List the outdated installed casks

       +o   rreeiinnssttaallll
           Reinstalls the given _c_a_s_k

       +o   ssttyyllee
           Checks style of the given _c_a_s_k using RuboCop

       +o   uunniinnssttaallll
           Uninstalls the given _c_a_s_k

       +o   uuppggrraaddee
           Upgrades all outdated casks or the specified casks

       +o   zzaapp
           Zaps all files associated with the given _c_a_s_k



       See also: mmaann bbrreeww

   cclleeaannuupp [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a|_c_a_s_k]
       Remove  stale  lock  files  and outdated downloads for all formulae and
       casks, and remove old versions of installed formulae. If arguments  are
       specified,  only  do this for the given formulae and casks. Removes all
       downloads more than 120 days old.  This  can  be  adjusted  with  HHOOMMEE--
       BBRREEWW__CCLLEEAANNUUPP__MMAAXX__AAGGEE__DDAAYYSS.

       ----pprruunnee
              Remove all cache files older than specified _d_a_y_s.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Show what would be removed, but do not actually remove anything.

       --ss     Scrub the cache, including downloads for even  the  latest  ver-
              sions.  Note  downloads for any installed formulae or casks will
              still not be deleted. If you want to delete those  too:  rrmm  --rrff
              ""$$((bbrreeww ----ccaacchhee))""

       ----pprruunnee--pprreeffiixx
              Only  prune  the  symlinks  and  directories from the prefix and
              remove no other files.

   ccoommmmaannddss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Show lists of built-in and external commands.

       --qq, ----qquuiieett
              List only the names of commands without category headers.

       ----iinncclluuddee--aalliiaasseess
              Include aliases of internal commands.

   ccoonnffiigg
       Show Homebrew and system configuration info useful  for  debugging.  If
       you  file  a  bug report, you will be required to provide this informa-
       tion.

   ddeeppss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Show dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Additional options specific  to  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       may  be appended to the command. When given multiple formula arguments,
       show the intersection of dependencies for each formula.

       --nn     Sort dependencies in topological order.

       ----11    Only show dependencies one level down, instead of recursing.

       ----uunniioonn
              Show the union of dependencies for multiple _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, instead  of
              the intersection.

       ----ffuullll--nnaammee
              List dependencies by their full name.

       ----iinncclluuddee--bbuuiilldd
              Include ::bbuuiilldd dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--ooppttiioonnaall
              Include ::ooppttiioonnaall dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--tteesstt
              Include ::tteesstt dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a (non-recursive).

       ----sskkiipp--rreeccoommmmeennddeedd
              Skip ::rreeccoommmmeennddeedd dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----iinncclluuddee--rreeqquuiirreemmeennttss
              Include requirements in addition to dependencies for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----ttrreeee Show  dependencies  as a tree. When given multiple formula argu-
              ments, show individual trees for each formula.

       ----aannnnoottaattee
              Mark any build, test, optional, or recommended  dependencies  as
              such in the output.

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              List  dependencies for formulae that are currently installed. If
              _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is specified, list only its dependencies that  are  cur-
              rently installed.

       ----aallll  List dependencies for all available formulae.

       ----ffoorr--eeaacchh
              Switch  into  the  mode  used by the ----aallll option, but only list
              dependencies for each provided _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, one  formula  per  line.
              This is used for debugging the ----iinnssttaalllleedd/----aallll display mode.

   ddeesscc [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] (_t_e_x_t|//_t_e_x_t//|_f_o_r_m_u_l_a)
       Display  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's  name and one-line description. Formula descriptions
       are cached; the cache is created  on  the  first  search,  making  that
       search slower than subsequent ones.

       --ss, ----sseeaarrcchh
              Search  both names and descriptions for _t_e_x_t. If _t_e_x_t is flanked
              by slashes, it is interpreted as a regular expression.

       --nn, ----nnaammee
              Search just names for _t_e_x_t. If _t_e_x_t is flanked by slashes, it is
              interpreted as a regular expression.

       --dd, ----ddeessccrriippttiioonn
              Search  just  descriptions  for  _t_e_x_t.  If  _t_e_x_t  is  flanked by
              slashes, it is interpreted as a regular expression.

   ddooccttoorr [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Check your system for potential problems. Will  exit  with  a  non-zero
       status  if  any  potential  problems  are found. Please note that these
       warnings are just used to help the Homebrew maintainers with  debugging
       if  you  file  an  issue. If everything you use Homebrew for is working
       fine: please don't worry or file an issue; just ignore this.

       ----lliisstt--cchheecckkss
              List all audit methods, which can be run  individually  if  pro-
              vided as arguments.

       --DD, ----aauuddiitt--ddeebbuugg
              Enable debugging and profiling of audit methods.

   ffeettcchh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Download  a  bottle  (if available) or source packages for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. For
       tarballs, also print SHA-256 checksums.

       ----HHEEAADD Fetch HEAD version instead of stable version.

       ----ddeevveell
              Fetch development version instead of stable version.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Remove a previously cached version and re-fetch.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Do a verbose VCS checkout, if the URL represents a VCS. This  is
              useful for seeing if an existing VCS cache has been updated.

       ----rreettrryy
              Retry  if  downloading fails or re-download if the checksum of a
              previously cached version no longer matches.

       ----ddeeppss Also download dependencies for any listed _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       --ss, ----bbuuiilldd--ffrroomm--ssoouurrccee
              Download source packages rather than a bottle.

       ----bbuuiilldd--bboottttllee
              Download source packages (for eventual bottling) rather  than  a
              bottle.

       ----ffoorrccee--bboottttllee
              Download a bottle if it exists for the current or newest version
              of macOS, even if it would not be used during installation.

   ggiisstt--llooggss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Upload logs for a failed build of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a to a new  Gist.  Presents  an
       error message if no logs are found.

       ----wwiitthh--hhoossttnnaammee
              Include the hostname in the Gist.

       --nn, ----nneeww--iissssuuee
              Automatically  create  a  new  issue  in  the appropriate GitHub
              repository after creating the Gist.

       --pp, ----pprriivvaattee
              The Gist will be marked private and will not appear in  listings
              but will be accessible with its link.

   hhoommee [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Open  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's  homepage in a browser, or open Homebrew's own homepage
       if no formula is provided.

   iinnffoo [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Display brief statistics for your Homebrew installation.

       If _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is provided, show summary of information about _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----aannaallyyttiiccss
              List global Homebrew analytics data or, if specified,  installa-
              tion  and  build  error data for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a (provided neither HHOOMMEE--
              BBRREEWW__NNOO__AANNAALLYYTTIICCSS nor HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__GGIITTHHUUBB__AAPPII are set).

       ----ddaayyss How many days of analytics data to retrieve. The value for  _d_a_y_s
              must be 3300, 9900 or 336655. The default is 3300.

       ----ccaatteeggoorryy
              Which type of analytics data to retrieve. The value for _c_a_t_e_g_o_r_y
              must be iinnssttaallll, iinnssttaallll--oonn--rreeqquueesstt or bbuuiilldd--eerrrroorr; ccaasskk--iinnssttaallll
              or ooss--vveerrssiioonn may be specified if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is not. The default is
              iinnssttaallll.

       ----ggiitthhuubb
              Open the GitHub source page for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a in a  browser.  To  view
              formula history locally: bbrreeww lloogg --pp _f_o_r_m_u_l_a

       ----jjssoonn Print  a  JSON  representation of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Currently the default
              and only accepted value for _v_e_r_s_i_o_n is  vv11.  See  the  docs  for
              examples  of  using the JSON output: _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_d_o_c_s_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_Q_u_e_r_y_-
              _i_n_g_-_B_r_e_w

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              Print JSON of formulae that are currently installed.

       ----aallll  Print JSON of all available formulae.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Show more verbose analytics data for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

   iinnssttaallll [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Install _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. Additional options specific to _f_o_r_m_u_l_a may be appended
       to the command.

       Unless  HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__NNOO__IINNSSTTAALLLL__CCLLEEAANNUUPP  is  set, bbrreeww cclleeaannuupp will then be
       run for the installed formulae or, every 30 days, for all formulae.

       --dd, ----ddeebbuugg
              If brewing fails, open an  interactive  debugging  session  with
              access to IRB or a shell inside the temporary build directory.

       ----eennvv  If  ssttdd is passed, use the standard build environment instead of
              superenv. If ssuuppeerr is passed, use superenv even if  the  formula
              specifies the standard build environment.

       ----iiggnnoorree--ddeeppeennddeenncciieess
              An  unsupported Homebrew development flag to skip installing any
              dependencies of any kind. If the dependencies  are  not  already
              present,  the formula will have issues. If you're not developing
              Homebrew, consider adjusting your PATH rather  than  using  this
              flag.

       ----oonnllyy--ddeeppeennddeenncciieess
              Install  the  dependencies  with  specified  options  but do not
              install the formula itself.

       ----cccc   Attempt to compile using the specified _c_o_m_p_i_l_e_r, which should be
              the  name of the compiler's executable, e.g. ggcccc--77 for GCC 7. In
              order to use  LLVM's  clang,  specify  llllvvmm__ccllaanngg.  To  use  the
              Apple-provided  clang,  specify  ccllaanngg.  This  option  will only
              accept compilers that are provided by Homebrew or  bundled  with
              macOS.  Please  do not file issues if you encounter errors while
              using this option.

       --ss, ----bbuuiilldd--ffrroomm--ssoouurrccee
              Compile _f_o_r_m_u_l_a from source even if a bottle is provided. Depen-
              dencies  will still be installed from bottles if they are avail-
              able.

       ----ffoorrccee--bboottttllee
              Install from a bottle if it exists for  the  current  or  newest
              version  of  macOS,  even  if  it would not normally be used for
              installation.

       ----iinncclluuddee--tteesstt
              Install testing dependencies required to run bbrreeww tteesstt  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----HHEEAADD If  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a  defines  it, install the HEAD version, aka. master,
              trunk, unstable.

       ----ffeettcchh--HHEEAADD
              Fetch the upstream repository to detect if the HEAD installation
              of  the  formula  is  outdated. Otherwise, the repository's HEAD
              will only be checked for updates when a new stable  or  develop-
              ment version has been released.

       ----kkeeeepp--ttmmpp
              Retain the temporary files created during installation.

       ----bbuuiilldd--bboottttllee
              Prepare  the  formula for eventual bottling during installation,
              skipping any post-install steps.

       ----bboottttllee--aarrcchh
              Optimise bottles for the specified architecture rather than  the
              oldest  architecture  supported by the version of macOS the bot-
              tles are built on.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Install without checking for previously  installed  keg-only  or
              non-migrated versions.

       --vv, ----vveerrbboossee
              Print the verification and postinstall steps.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ttiimmeess
              Print install times for each formula at the end of the run.

       --ii, ----iinntteerraaccttiivvee
              Download  and  patch _f_o_r_m_u_l_a, then open a shell. This allows the
              user to run ..//ccoonnffiigguurree ----hheellpp and otherwise  determine  how  to
              turn the software package into a Homebrew package.

       --gg, ----ggiitt
              Create  a  Git  repository,  useful  for creating patches to the
              software.

   lleeaavveess
       List installed formulae that are not dependencies of another  installed
       formula.

   lliinnkk, llnn [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Symlink  all  of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a's installed files into Homebrew's prefix. This
       is done automatically when you install formulae but can be  useful  for
       DIY installations.

       ----oovveerrwwrriittee
              Delete files that already exist in the prefix while linking.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              List files which would be linked or deleted by bbrreeww lliinnkk ----oovveerr--
              wwrriittee without actually linking or deleting any files.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Allow keg-only formulae to be linked.

       List all installed formulae or casks

       If _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is provided, summarise the paths within its current keg.

       ----ffuullll--nnaammee

              passed,  other  options  (i.e.  --11, --ll, --rr and --tt) are passed to
              llss(1) which produces the actual output.

       ----uunnbbrreewweedd
              List files in Homebrew's prefix not installed by Homebrew.

       ----vveerrssiioonnss
              Show the version number for  installed  formulae,  or  only  the
              specified formulae if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided.

       ----mmuullttiippllee
              Only show formulae with multiple versions installed.

       ----ppiinnnneedd
              Show  the  versions  of  pinned  formulae, or only the specified
              (pinned) formulae if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided. See also ppiinn,  uunnppiinn.

       ----ffoorrmmuullaa
              List only formulae.

       ----ccaasskk List only casks.

       --11     Force  output to be one entry per line. This is the default when
              output is not to a terminal.

       --ll     List in long format. If the output is to a terminal, a total sum
              for all the file sizes is printed before the long listing.

       --rr     Reverse  the order of the sort to list the oldest entries first.

       --tt     Sort by time modified, listing most recently modified first.

   lloogg [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]

   ttaapp [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o] [_U_R_L]
       Tap a formula repository.

       If no arguments are provided, list all installed taps.

       With _U_R_L unspecified, tap a formula repository from GitHub using HTTPS.
       Since so many taps are hosted on GitHub, this command is a shortcut for
       bbrreeww ttaapp _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o hhttttppss::////ggiitthhuubb..ccoomm//_u_s_e_r//hhoommeebbrreeww--_r_e_p_o.

       With  _U_R_L  specified, tap a formula repository from anywhere, using any
       transport protocol that ggiitt(1) handles. The one-argument  form  of  ttaapp
       simplifies  but also limits. This two-argument command makes no assump-
       tions, so taps can be cloned from places other than  GitHub  and  using
       protocols other than HTTPS, e.g. SSH, git, HTTP, FTP(S), rsync.

       ----ffuullll Convert  a shallow clone to a full clone without untapping. Taps
              are only cloned as shallow clones on continuous integration,  or
              if ----sshhaallllooww was originally passed.

              Fetch  tap  as  a shallow clone rather than a full clone. Useful

              Auto-update tap even if it is not hosted on GitHub. By  default,
              only  taps  hosted  on  GitHub are auto-updated (for performance
              reasons).

       ----rreeppaaiirr
              Migrate tapped formulae from  symlink-based  to  directory-based
              structure.

       ----lliisstt--ppiinnnneedd

   aauuddiitt [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check _f_o_r_m_u_l_a for Homebrew coding style violations. This should be  run
       before  submitting a new formula. If no _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are provided, check all
       locally available formulae and skip style  checks.  Will  exit  with  a
       non-zero status if any errors are found.

       ----ssttrriicctt
              Run additional, stricter style checks.

       ----ggiitt  Run additional, slower style checks that navigate the Git repos-
              itory.

       ----oonnlliinnee
              Run additional, slower style checks that require a network  con-
              nection.

       ----nneeww--ffoorrmmuullaa
              Run  various  additional style checks to determine if a new for-
              mula is eligible for Homebrew. This should be used when creating
              new formula and implies ----ssttrriicctt and ----oonnlliinnee.

       ----ttaapp  Check the formulae within the given tap, specified as _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o.

       ----ffiixx  Fix style violations automatically using RuboCop's  auto-correct
              feature.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ccoopp--nnaammeess
              Include the RuboCop cop name for each violation in the output.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ffiilleennaammee
              Prefix  every line of output with the file or formula name being
              audited, to make output easy to grep.

       ----sskkiipp--ssttyyllee
              Skip running non-RuboCop style checks. Useful  if  you  plan  on
              running bbrreeww ssttyyllee separately. Default unless a formula is spec-
              ified by name

       --DD, ----aauuddiitt--ddeebbuugg
              Enable debugging and profiling of audit methods.

       ----oonnllyy Specify a comma-separated _m_e_t_h_o_d list to only  run  the  methods
              named aauuddiitt___m_e_t_h_o_d.

       ----eexxcceepptt
              Specify  a comma-separated _m_e_t_h_o_d list to skip running the meth-
              ods named aauuddiitt___m_e_t_h_o_d.

       ----oonnllyy--ccooppss
              Specify a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to check for  violations  of
              only the listed RuboCop cops.

       ----eexxcceepptt--ccooppss
              Specify  a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to skip checking for viola-
              tions of the listed RuboCop cops.

   bboottttllee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Generate a bottle (binary package) from a formula  that  was  installed
       with  ----bbuuiilldd--bboottttllee.  If  the  formula specifies a rebuild version, it
       will be incremented in  the  generated  DSL.  Passing  ----kkeeeepp--oolldd  will
       attempt  to  keep  it  at  its  original value, while ----nnoo--rreebbuuiilldd will
       remove it.

       ----sskkiipp--rreellooccaattiioonn
              Do not check if the bottle can be marked as relocatable.

       ----ffoorrccee--ccoorree--ttaapp
              Build a bottle even if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is not in  hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree  or  any
              installed taps.

       ----nnoo--rreebbuuiilldd
              If  the  formula specifies a rebuild version, remove it from the
              generated DSL.

       ----kkeeeepp--oolldd
              If the formula specifies a rebuild version, attempt to  preserve
              its value in the generated DSL.

       ----jjssoonn Write  bottle  information  to a JSON file, which can be used as
              the value for ----mmeerrggee.

       ----mmeerrggee
              Generate an updated bottle block for a  formula  and  optionally
              merge  it  into  the  formula  file.  Instead of a formula name,
              requires the path to a JSON  file  generated  with  bbrreeww  bboottttllee
              ----jjssoonn _f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----wwrriittee
              Write  changes  to the formula file. A new commit will be gener-
              ated unless ----nnoo--ccoommmmiitt is passed.

       ----nnoo--ccoommmmiitt
              When passed with ----wwrriittee, a new commit will not generated  after
              writing changes to the formula file.

       ----rroooott--uurrll
              Use the specified _U_R_L as the root of the bottle's URL instead of
              Homebrew's default.

   bbuummpp [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]

       Create a pull request to update _c_a_s_k with a new version.

       A best effort to determine the _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 will be made if the value is not

              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----wwrriittee
              Make the expected file  modifications  without  taking  any  Git

              Don't run bbrreeww ccaasskk ssttyyllee ----ffiixx before opening the PR.

       ----nnoo--bbrroowwssee
              Print the pull request URL instead of opening in a browser.

       ----nnoo--ffoorrkk
              Don't try to fork the repository.

       ----vveerrssiioonn
              Specify the new _v_e_r_s_i_o_n for the cask.

       ----mmeessssaaggee
              Append _m_e_s_s_a_g_e to the default pull request message.

       ----uurrll  Specify the _U_R_L for the new download.

       ----sshhaa225566
              Specify the _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 checksum of the new download.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee

   bbuummpp--ffoorrmmuullaa--pprr [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Create a pull request to update _f_o_r_m_u_l_a with a new URL or a new tag.

       If a _U_R_L is specified, the _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 checksum of the new download  should
       also  be  specified. A best effort to determine the _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 and _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       name will be made if either or both values  are  not  supplied  by  the
       user.

       If  a  _t_a_g  is specified, the Git commit _r_e_v_i_s_i_o_n corresponding to that
       tag should also be specified. A best effort to determine  the  _r_e_v_i_s_i_o_n
       will be made if the value is not supplied by the user.

       If  a  _v_e_r_s_i_o_n  is  specified,  a  best effort to determine the _U_R_L and
       _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 or the _t_a_g and _r_e_v_i_s_i_o_n will be made if  both  values  are  not
       supplied by the user.

       _N_o_t_e_:  this  command  cannot  be  used  to  transition a formula from a
       URL-and-SHA-256 style specification into a tag-and-revision style spec-
       ification,  nor  vice  versa. It must use whichever style specification
       the formula already uses.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----wwrriittee
              Make the expected file  modifications  without  taking  any  Git
              actions.

       ----ccoommmmiitt
              When  passed  with  ----wwrriittee, generate a new commit after writing
              changes to the formula file.

       ----nnoo--aauuddiitt
              Don't run bbrreeww aauuddiitt before opening the PR.

       ----ssttrriicctt
              Run bbrreeww aauuddiitt ----ssttrriicctt before opening the PR.

       ----nnoo--bbrroowwssee
              Print the pull request URL instead of opening in a browser.

       ----nnoo--ffoorrkk
              Don't try to fork the repository.

       ----mmiirrrroorr
              Use the specified _U_R_L as a mirror URL. If _U_R_L is  a  comma-sepa-
              rated list of URLs, multiple mirrors will be added.

       ----vveerrssiioonn
              Use  the specified _v_e_r_s_i_o_n to override the value parsed from the
              URL or tag. Note that ----vveerrssiioonn==00  can  be  used  to  delete  an
              existing version override from a formula if it has become redun-
              dant.

       ----mmeessssaaggee
              Append _m_e_s_s_a_g_e to the default pull request message.

       ----uurrll  Specify the _U_R_L for the new download. If a _U_R_L is specified, the
              _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 checksum of the new download should also be specified.

       ----sshhaa225566
              Specify the _S_H_A_-_2_5_6 checksum of the new download.

       ----ttaagg  Specify the new git commit _t_a_g for the formula.

       ----rreevviissiioonn
              Specify  the new git commit _r_e_v_i_s_i_o_n corresponding to the speci-
              fied _t_a_g.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Ignore duplicate open PRs. Remove all mirrors if  --mirror=  was
              not specified.

   bbuummpp--rreevviissiioonn [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a ...]

   ccrreeaattee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _U_R_L
       Generate a formula for the downloadable file at _U_R_L and open it in  the
       editor.  Homebrew will attempt to automatically derive the formula name
       and version, but if it fails, you'll have to make  your  own  template.
       The wwggeett formula serves as a simple example. For the complete API, see:
       _h_t_t_p_s_:_/_/_r_u_b_y_d_o_c_._b_r_e_w_._s_h_/_F_o_r_m_u_l_a

       ----aauuttoottoooollss
              Create a basic template for an Autotools-style build.

       ----ccmmaakkee
              Create a basic template for a CMake-style build.

       ----ccrryyssttaall
              Create a basic template for a Crystal build.

       ----ggoo   Create a basic template for a Go build.

       ----mmeessoonn
              Create a basic template for a Meson-style build.

       ----nnooddee Create a basic template for a Node build.

       ----ppeerrll Create a basic template for a Perl build.

       ----ppyytthhoonn
              Create a basic template for a Python build.

       ----rruubbyy Create a basic template for a Ruby build.

       ----rruusstt Create a basic template for a Rust build.

       ----nnoo--ffeettcchh
              Homebrew will not download _U_R_L to the cache and  will  thus  not
              add  its  SHA-256  to the formula for you, nor will it check the
              GitHub API for GitHub projects (to fill out its description  and
              homepage).

       ----HHEEAADD Indicate that _U_R_L points to the package's repository rather than
              a file.

       ----sseett--nnaammee
              Explicitly set the _n_a_m_e of the new formula.

       ----sseett--vveerrssiioonn
              Explicitly set the _v_e_r_s_i_o_n of the new formula.

       ----sseett--lliicceennssee
              Explicitly set the _l_i_c_e_n_s_e of the new formula.

       ----ttaapp  Generate the new formula within  the  given  tap,  specified  as
              _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Ignore errors for disallowed formula names and named that shadow
              aliases.

   ddiiyy [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Automatically determine the installation prefix for non-Homebrew  soft-
       ware.  Using  the  output  from  this command, you can install your own
       software into the Cellar and then link it into Homebrew's  prefix  with
       bbrreeww lliinnkk.

       ----nnaammee Explicitly set the _n_a_m_e of the package being installed.

       ----vveerrssiioonn
              Explicitly set the _v_e_r_s_i_o_n of the package being installed.

   eeddiitt [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Open  _f_o_r_m_u_l_a  in  the editor set by EEDDIITTOORR or HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__EEDDIITTOORR, or open
       the Homebrew repository for editing if no formula is provided.

   eexxttrraacctt [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a _t_a_p
       Look through repository history to find the most recent version of _f_o_r_-
       _m_u_l_a and create a copy in _t_a_p//FFoorrmmuullaa//_f_o_r_m_u_l_a@@_v_e_r_s_i_o_n..rrbb. If the tap is
       not installed yet, attempt to install/clone the tap before  continuing.
       To  extract  a  formula  from  a  tap that is not hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree use its
       fully-qualified form of _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o//_f_o_r_m_u_l_a.

       ----vveerrssiioonn
              Extract the specified _v_e_r_s_i_o_n of _f_o_r_m_u_l_a  instead  of  the  most
              recent.

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Overwrite the destination formula if it already exists.

   ffoorrmmuullaa _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Display the path where _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is located.

   iinnssttaallll--bbuunnddlleerr--ggeemmss
       Install Homebrew's Bundler gems.

   iirrbb [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Enter the interactive Homebrew Ruby shell.

       ----eexxaammpplleess
              Show several examples.

       ----pprryy  Use Pry instead of IRB. Implied if HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__PPRRYY is set.

   lliinnkkaaggee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check  the library links from the given _f_o_r_m_u_l_a kegs. If no _f_o_r_m_u_l_a are
       provided, check all kegs. Raises an error if run on uninstalled  formu-
       lae.

       ----tteesstt Show  only  missing libraries and exit with a non-zero status if
              any missing libraries are found.

       ----rreevveerrssee
              For every library that a keg references, print  its  dylib  path
              followed by the binaries that link to it.

       ----ccaacchheedd
              Print the cached linkage values stored in HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__CCAACCHHEE, set by
              a previous bbrreeww lliinnkkaaggee run.

   lliivveecchheecckk [_f_o_r_m_u_l_a_e]
       Check for newer versions of formulae from upstream.

       If no formula argument is passed, the list  of  formulae  to  check  is
       taken from HHOOMMEEBBRREEWW__LLIIVVEECCHHEECCKK__WWAATTCCHHLLIISSTT or ~~//..bbrreeww__lliivveecchheecckk__wwaattcchhlliisstt.

       ----ffuullll--nnaammee
              Print formulae with fully-qualified names.

       ----ttaapp  Check the formulae within the given tap, specified as _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o.

       ----iinnssttaalllleedd
              Check formulae that are currently installed.

       ----jjssoonn Output informations in JSON format.

       ----aallll  Check all available formulae.

       ----nneewweerr--oonnllyy
              Show the latest version only if it's newer than the formula.

   mmaann [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Generate Homebrew's manpages.

       ----ffaaiill--iiff--cchhaannggeedd
              Return a failing status code if changes are detected in the man-
              page outputs. This can be used to notify CI  when  the  manpages
              are  out  of  date.  Additionally, the date used in new manpages
              will match those in the existing manpages (to  allow  comparison
              without factoring in the date).

       ----lliinnkk This is now done automatically by bbrreeww uuppddaattee.

   pprr--aauuttoommeerrggee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Find  pull requests that can be automatically merged using bbrreeww pprr--ppuubb--
       lliisshh.

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----wwiitthh--llaabbeell
              Pull requests must have this label.

       ----wwiitthhoouutt--llaabbeellss
              Pull requests must not have these labels (default: ddoo nnoott mmeerrggee,
              nneeww ffoorrmmuullaa).

       ----wwiitthhoouutt--aapppprroovvaall
              Pull requests do not require approval to be merged.

       ----ppuubblliisshh
              Run bbrreeww pprr--ppuubblliisshh on matching pull requests.

       ----iiggnnoorree--ffaaiilluurreess
              Include pull requests that have failing status checks.

   pprr--ppuubblliisshh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t [_p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t ...]
       Publish  bottles for a pull request with GitHub Actions. Requires write
       access to the repository.

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----wwoorrkkffllooww
              Target workflow filename (default:  ppuubblliisshh--ccoommmmiitt--bboottttlleess..yymmll).

   pprr--ppuullll [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t [_p_u_l_l___r_e_q_u_e_s_t ...]
       Download  and  publish bottles, and apply the bottle commit from a pull
       request with artifacts generated  by  GitHub  Actions.  Requires  write
       access to the repository.

       ----nnoo--ppuubblliisshh
              Download  the  bottles,  apply  the bottle commit and upload the
              bottles to Bintray, but don't publish them.

       ----nnoo--uuppllooaadd
              Download the bottles and apply  the  bottle  commit,  but  don't
              upload to Bintray.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----cclleeaann
              Do not amend the commits from pull requests.

       ----kkeeeepp--oolldd
              If  the formula specifies a rebuild version, attempt to preserve
              its value in the generated DSL.

       ----bbrraanncchh--ookkaayy
              Do not warn if pulling to a branch besides  master  (useful  for
              testing).

       ----rreessoollvvee
              When a patch fails to apply, leave in progress and allow user to
              resolve, instead of aborting.

       ----wwaarrnn--oonn--uuppllooaadd--ffaaiilluurree
              Warn instead of raising an error if  the  bottle  upload  fails.
              Useful for repairing bottle uploads that previously failed.

       ----wwoorrkkffllooww
              Retrieve   artifacts   from  the  specified  workflow  (default:
              tteessttss..yymmll).

       ----aarrttiiffaacctt
              Download artifacts with the specified name (default: bboottttlleess).

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--oorrgg
              Upload to the specified  Bintray  organisation  (default:  hhoommee--
              bbrreeww).

       ----ttaapp  Target tap repository (default: hhoommeebbrreeww//ccoorree).

       ----rroooott--uurrll
              Use the specified _U_R_L as the root of the bottle's URL instead of
              Homebrew's default.

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--mmiirrrroorr
              Use the specified Bintray  repository  to  automatically  mirror
              stable URLs defined in the formulae (default: mmiirrrroorr).

   pprr--uuppllooaadd [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Apply the bottle commit and publish bottles to Bintray.

       ----nnoo--ppuubblliisshh
              Apply  the  bottle commit and upload the bottles, but don't pub-
              lish them.

       ----kkeeeepp--oolldd
              If the formula specifies a rebuild version, attempt to  preserve
              its value in the generated DSL.

       --nn, ----ddrryy--rruunn
              Print what would be done rather than doing it.

       ----wwaarrnn--oonn--uuppllooaadd--ffaaiilluurree
              Warn  instead  of  raising  an error if the bottle upload fails.
              Useful for repairing bottle uploads that previously failed.

       ----bbiinnttrraayy--oorrgg
              Upload to the specified  Bintray  organisation  (default:  hhoommee--
              bbrreeww).

       ----rroooott--uurrll
              Use the specified _U_R_L as the root of the bottle's URL instead of
              Homebrew's default.

   pprrooff [_c_o_m_m_a_n_d]
       Run Homebrew with a Ruby profiler, e.g. bbrreeww pprrooff rreeaaddaallll.

   rreelleeaassee--nnootteess [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_p_r_e_v_i_o_u_s___t_a_g] [_e_n_d___r_e_f]
       Print the merged pull requests on Homebrew/brew between two  Git  refs.

   rruubbyy (--ee _t_e_x_t|_f_i_l_e)
       Run a Ruby instance with Homebrew's libraries loaded, e.g. bbrreeww rruubbyy --ee
       ""ppuuttss ::ggcccc..ff..ddeeppss"" or bbrreeww rruubbyy ssccrriipptt..rrbb.

       --rr     Load a library using rreeqquuiirree.

       --ee     Execute the given text string as a script.

   sshh [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_i_l_e]
       Homebrew  build environment that uses years-battle-hardened build logic
       to help your ..//ccoonnffiigguurree &&&& mmaakkee &&&& mmaakkee  iinnssttaallll  and  even  your  ggeemm
       iinnssttaallll  succeed. Especially handy if you run Homebrew in an Xcode-only
       configuration since it adds tools like mmaakkee to your  PPAATTHH  which  build
       systems would not find otherwise.

       ----eennvv  Use  the standard PPAATTHH instead of superenv's when ssttdd is passed.

       --cc, ----ccmmdd
              Execute commands in a non-interactive shell.

   ssppoonnssoorrss
       Print a Markdown summary of Homebrew's GitHub  Sponsors,  suitable  for
       pasting into a README.

   ssttyyllee [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] [_f_i_l_e|_t_a_p|_f_o_r_m_u_l_a]
       Check formulae or files for conformance to Homebrew style guidelines.

       Lists  of  _f_i_l_e,  _t_a_p and _f_o_r_m_u_l_a may not be combined. If none are pro-
       vided, ssttyyllee will run style  checks  on  the  whole  Homebrew  library,
       including core code and all formulae.

       ----ffiixx  Fix  style violations automatically using RuboCop's auto-correct
              feature.

       ----ddiissppllaayy--ccoopp--nnaammeess
              Include the RuboCop cop name for each violation in the output.

       ----oonnllyy--ccooppss
              Specify a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to check for  violations  of
              only the listed RuboCop cops.

       ----eexxcceepptt--ccooppss
              Specify  a comma-separated _c_o_p_s list to skip checking for viola-
              tions of the listed RuboCop cops.

   ttaapp--nneeww _u_s_e_r//_r_e_p_o
       Generate the template files for a new tap.

   tteesstt [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Run the test method provided by an installed formula. There is no stan-
       dard  output or return code, but generally it should notify the user if
       something is wrong with the installed formula.

       _E_x_a_m_p_l_e_: bbrreeww iinnssttaallll jjrruubbyy &&&& bbrreeww tteesstt jjrruubbyy

       ----ddeevveell
              Test the development version of a formula.

       ----HHEEAADD Test the head version of a formula.

       ----kkeeeepp--ttmmpp
              Retain the temporary files created for the test.

       ----rreettrryy
              Retry if a testing fails.

   tteessttss [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Run Homebrew's unit and integration tests.

       ----ccoovveerraaggee
              Generate code coverage reports.

       ----ggeenneerriicc
              Run only OS-agnostic tests.

       ----nnoo--ccoommppaatt
              Do not load the compatibility layer when running tests.

       ----oonnlliinnee
              Include tests that use the GitHub API and tests that use any  of
              the taps for official external commands.

       ----bbyyeebbuugg
              Enable debugging using byebug.

       ----oonnllyy Run  only _t_e_s_t___s_c_r_i_p_t__ssppeecc..rrbb. Appending ::_l_i_n_e___n_u_m_b_e_r will start
              at a specific line.

       ----sseeeedd Randomise tests with the specified _v_a_l_u_e  instead  of  a  random
              seed.

   ttyyppeecchheecckk
       Check for typechecking errors using Sorbet.

       --qq, ----qquuiieett
              Silence all non-critical errors.

       ----uuppddaattee--ddeeffiinniittiioonnss
              Update Tapioca gem definitions of recently bumped gems

       ----ffaaiill--iiff--nnoott--cchhaannggeedd
              Return  a failing status code if all gems are up to date and gem
              definitions do not need a tapioca update

       ----ddiirr  Typecheck all files in a specific directory.

       ----ffiillee Typecheck a single file.

       ----iiggnnoorree
              Ignores input files that contain the given string in their paths
              (relative to the input path passed to Sorbet).

   uunnppaacckk [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a
       Unpack  the source files for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a into subdirectories of the current
       working directory.

       ----ddeessttddiirr
              Create subdirectories in the directory named by _p_a_t_h instead.

       ----ppaattcchh

       --gg, ----ggiitt

       --ff, ----ffoorrccee
              Overwrite the destination directory if it already exists.

   uuppddaattee--lliicceennssee--ddaattaa [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]

              Return  a  failing status code if current license data's version

   uuppddaattee--ppyytthhoonn--rreessoouurrcceess [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s] _f_o_r_m_u_l_a

       --pp, ----pprriinntt--oonnllyy

              Don't fail if _f_o_r_m_u_l_a is not a PyPI package.

       ----vveerrssiioonn
              Use the specified _v_e_r_s_i_o_n when finding resources for _f_o_r_m_u_l_a. If

   uuppddaattee--tteesstt [_o_p_t_i_o_n_s]
       Run  a  test  of bbrreeww uuppddaattee with a new repository clone. If no options

              Use the specified _c_o_m_m_i_t as the start commit.

   vveennddoorr--ggeemmss
       Install and commit Homebrew's vendored gems.

GGLLOOBBAALL OOPPTTIIOONNSS
       These options are applicable across multiple subcommands.
